definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: There’s no need to add to the corniness of the holiday by throwing in a wedding proposal.
sentences.chinese: 沒必要再在這個節日搞什麼求婚之類的過時東西了。

sentences.english: Tony be backward in propose to her .
sentences.chinese: 湯尼在向她求婚時畏縮了。

sentences.english: I'm tickled pink to hear that Bob's asked Susan to marry him.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說鮑勃向蘇三求婚非常高興。
丹妮絲接受了湯姆的求婚。

sentences.english: A male crab asked a female crab to marry him.
sentences.chinese: 一隻公螃蟹向母螃蟹求婚。

sentences.english: When cheng super real appeared was holding a ring to propose to tang sugar.
sentences.chinese: 當程超羣真正出現的時候便是拿着戒指向唐糖求婚。

sentences.english: Some day, some male proposes in the park to some female.
sentences.chinese: 某日，某男在公園裏向某女求婚。

sentences.english: On the night of their ice-skating date, Jack proposed.
sentences.chinese: 在他們滑冰約會的那個晚上，Jack向她求婚。

sentences.english: West light finally is not to live, to propose to show.
sentences.chinese: 西光終於挺不住了，向秀秀求婚。

sentences.english: Cheng was superior to tell two of them have been proposed and tang sugar.
sentences.chinese: 程超羣來了後告訴二人已經和唐糖求婚了。

sentences.english: Baroness a lawyer assistant to propose to esser, but was refused.
sentences.chinese: 男爵夫人的一名律師助手向艾瑟求婚，但是被拒絕了。

sentences.english: They drop in volcano, alive bound is extremely cold propose.
sentences.chinese: 他們在火山下降，在世界寒極求婚。

sentences.english: I will never try to woo someone with fine car or gift.
sentences.chinese: 我絕不會用香車和禮物來求婚。

sentences.english: A maiden with many wooers ofter chooses the worst.
sentences.chinese: 有許多人向她求婚的少女，常常選中最差的一個。

sentences.english: Many boys courted Lynn , but she turned them all down.
sentences.chinese: 許多男孩子向林恩求婚，但都被她拒絕了。

sentences.english: She pondered his marriage proposal for a week.
sentences.chinese: 她考慮了一週他向她的求婚。

definition: to announce publicly/to explain oneself/to reveal one's feelings/to confess/to declare one's love
to explain oneself/to express/to reveal one's thoughts or feelings/declaration/confession
(of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
to obtain a certificate or license etc/(PRC) to obtain a marriage license/to marry
to flee to avoid an arranged marriage
variant of 訂婚|订婚[ding4 hun1]
